34#define HB_COMMON_H

40#ifndef HB_BEGIN_DECLS
41# ifdef __cplusplus
42# define HB_BEGIN_DECLS extern "C" {
43# define HB_END_DECLS }
44# else /* !__cplusplus */
45# define HB_BEGIN_DECLS
46# define HB_END_DECLS
47# endif /* !__cplusplus */
48#endif
49
50#if defined (_SVR4) || defined (SVR4) || defined (__OpenBSD__) || \
51 defined (_sgi) || defined (__sun) || defined (sun) || \
52 defined (__digital__) || defined (__HP_cc)
53# include <inttypes.h>
54#elif defined (_AIX)
55# include <sys/inttypes.h>
56#elif defined (_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1600
57/* VS 2010 (_MSC_VER 1600) has stdint.h */
58typedef __int8 int8_t;
59typedef unsigned __int8 uint8_t;
60typedef __int16 int16_t;
61typedef unsigned __int16 uint16_t;
62typedef __int32 int32_t;
63typedef unsigned __int32 uint32_t;
64typedef __int64 int64_t;
65typedef unsigned __int64 uint64_t;
66#elif defined (__KERNEL__)
67# include <linux/types.h>
68#else
69# include <stdint.h>
70#endif
71
72#if defined(__GNUC__) && ((__GNUC__ > 3) || (__GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 1))
73#define HB_DEPRECATED __attribute__((__deprecated__))
74#elif defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1300)
75#define HB_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
76#else
77#define HB_DEPRECATED
78#endif
79
80#if defined(__GNUC__) && ((__GNUC__ > 4) || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 5))
81#define HB_DEPRECATED_FOR(f) __attribute__((__deprecated__("Use '" #f "' instead")))
82#elif defined(_MSC_FULL_VER) && (_MSC_FULL_VER > 140050320)
83#define HB_DEPRECATED_FOR(f) __declspec(deprecated("is deprecated. Use '" #f "' instead"))
84#else
85#define HB_DEPRECATED_FOR(f) HB_DEPRECATED
86#endif
87

89HB_BEGIN_DECLS
90
91/**
92 * hb_bool_t:
93 *
94 * Data type for booleans.
95 *
96 **/
97typedef int hb_bool_t;
98
99/**
100 * hb_codepoint_t:
101 *
102 * Data type for holding Unicode codepoints. Also
103 * used to hold glyph IDs.
104 *
105 **/
106typedef uint32_t hb_codepoint_t;
107/**
108 * hb_position_t:
109 *
110 * Data type for holding a single coordinate value.
111 * Contour points and other multi-dimensional data are
112 * stored as tuples of #hb_position_t's.
113 *
114 **/
115typedef int32_t hb_position_t;
116/**
117 * hb_mask_t:
118 *
119 * Data type for bitmasks.
120 *
121 **/
122typedef uint32_t hb_mask_t;
123
124typedef union _hb_var_int_t {
125 uint32_t u32;
126 int32_t i32;
127 uint16_t u16[2];
128 int16_t i16[2];
129 uint8_t u8[4];
130 int8_t i8[4];
131} hb_var_int_t;
132
133typedef union _hb_var_num_t {
134 float f;
135 uint32_t u32;
136 int32_t i32;
137 uint16_t u16[2];
138 int16_t i16[2];
139 uint8_t u8[4];
140 int8_t i8[4];
141} hb_var_num_t;
142
143
144/* hb_tag_t */
145
146/**
147 * hb_tag_t:
148 *
149 * Data type for tag identifiers. Tags are four
150 * byte integers, each byte representing a character.
151 *
152 * Tags are used to identify tables, design-variation axes,
153 * scripts, languages, font features, and baselines with
154 * human-readable names.
155 *
156 **/
157typedef uint32_t hb_tag_t;
158
159/**
160 * HB_TAG:
161 * @c1: 1st character of the tag
162 * @c2: 2nd character of the tag
163 * @c3: 3rd character of the tag
164 * @c4: 4th character of the tag
165 *
166 * Constructs an #hb_tag_t from four character literals.
167 *
168 **/
169#define HB_TAG(c1,c2,c3,c4) ((hb_tag_t)((((uint32_t)(c1)&0xFF)<<24)|(((uint32_t)(c2)&0xFF)<<16)|(((uint32_t)(c3)&0xFF)<<8)|((uint32_t)(c4)&0xFF)))
170
171/**
172 * HB_UNTAG:
173 * @tag: an #hb_tag_t
174 *
175 * Extracts four character literals from an #hb_tag_t.
176 *
177 * Since: 0.6.0
178 *
179 **/
180#define HB_UNTAG(tag) (uint8_t)(((tag)>>24)&0xFF), (uint8_t)(((tag)>>16)&0xFF), (uint8_t)(((tag)>>8)&0xFF), (uint8_t)((tag)&0xFF)
181
182/**
183 * HB_TAG_NONE:
184 *
185 * Unset #hb_tag_t.
186 */
187#define HB_TAG_NONE HB_TAG(0,0,0,0)
188/**
189 * HB_TAG_MAX:
190 *
191 * Maximum possible unsigned #hb_tag_t.
192 *
193 * Since: 0.9.26
194 */
195#define HB_TAG_MAX HB_TAG(0xff,0xff,0xff,0xff)
196/**
197 * HB_TAG_MAX_SIGNED:
198 *
199 * Maximum possible signed #hb_tag_t.
200 *
201 * Since: 0.9.33
202 */
203#define HB_TAG_MAX_SIGNED HB_TAG(0x7f,0xff,0xff,0xff)
204
205/* len=-1 means str is NUL-terminated. */
206HB_EXTERN hb_tag_t
207hb_tag_from_string (const char *str, int len);
208
209/* buf should have 4 bytes. */
210HB_EXTERN void
211hb_tag_to_string (hb_tag_t tag, char *buf);
212
213
214/**
215 * hb_direction_t:
216 * @HB_DIRECTION_INVALID: Initial, unset direction.
217 * @HB_DIRECTION_LTR: Text is set horizontally from left to right.
218 * @HB_DIRECTION_RTL: Text is set horizontally from right to left.
219 * @HB_DIRECTION_TTB: Text is set vertically from top to bottom.
220 * @HB_DIRECTION_BTT: Text is set vertically from bottom to top.
221 *
222 * The direction of a text segment or buffer.
223 *
224 * A segment can also be tested for horizontal or vertical
225 * orientation (irrespective of specific direction) with
226 * HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL() or HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL().
227 *
228 */
229typedef enum {
230 HB_DIRECTION_INVALID = 0,
231 HB_DIRECTION_LTR = 4,
232 HB_DIRECTION_RTL,
233 HB_DIRECTION_TTB,
234 HB_DIRECTION_BTT
235} hb_direction_t;
236
237/* len=-1 means str is NUL-terminated */
238HB_EXTERN hb_direction_t
239hb_direction_from_string (const char *str, int len);
240
241HB_EXTERN const char *
242hb_direction_to_string (hb_direction_t direction);
243
244/**
245 * HB_DIRECTION_IS_VALID:
246 * @dir: #hb_direction_t to test
247 *
248 * Tests whether a text direction is valid.
249 *
250 **/
251#define HB_DIRECTION_IS_VALID(dir) ((((unsigned int) (dir)) & ~3U) == 4)
252/* Direction must be valid for the following */
253/**
254 * HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL:
255 * @dir: #hb_direction_t to test
256 *
257 * Tests whether a text direction is horizontal. Requires
258 * that the direction be valid.
259 *
260 **/
261#define HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL(dir) ((((unsigned int) (dir)) & ~1U) == 4)
262/**
263 * HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL:
264 * @dir: #hb_direction_t to test
265 *
266 * Tests whether a text direction is vertical. Requires
267 * that the direction be valid.
268 *
269 **/
270#define HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL(dir) ((((unsigned int) (dir)) & ~1U) == 6)
271/**
272 * HB_DIRECTION_IS_FORWARD:
273 * @dir: #hb_direction_t to test
274 *
275 * Tests whether a text direction moves forward (from left to right, or from
276 * top to bottom). Requires that the direction be valid.
277 *
278 **/
279#define HB_DIRECTION_IS_FORWARD(dir) ((((unsigned int) (dir)) & ~2U) == 4)
280/**
281 * HB_DIRECTION_IS_BACKWARD:
282 * @dir: #hb_direction_t to test
283 *
284 * Tests whether a text direction moves backward (from right to left, or from
285 * bottom to top). Requires that the direction be valid.
286 *
287 **/
288#define HB_DIRECTION_IS_BACKWARD(dir) ((((unsigned int) (dir)) & ~2U) == 5)
289/**
290 * HB_DIRECTION_REVERSE:
291 * @dir: #hb_direction_t to reverse
292 *
293 * Reverses a text direction. Requires that the direction
294 * be valid.
295 *
296 **/
297#define HB_DIRECTION_REVERSE(dir) ((hb_direction_t) (((unsigned int) (dir)) ^ 1))
298
299
300/* hb_language_t */
301
302/**
303 * hb_language_t:
304 *
305 * Data type for languages. Each #hb_language_t corresponds to a BCP 47
306 * language tag.
307 *
308 */
309typedef const struct hb_language_impl_t *hb_language_t;
310
311HB_EXTERN hb_language_t
312hb_language_from_string (const char *str, int len);
313
314HB_EXTERN const char *
315hb_language_to_string (hb_language_t language);
316
317/**
318 * HB_LANGUAGE_INVALID:
319 *
320 * An unset #hb_language_t.
321 *
322 * Since: 0.6.0
323 */
324#define HB_LANGUAGE_INVALID ((hb_language_t) 0)
325
326HB_EXTERN hb_language_t
327hb_language_get_default (void);
328
329HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
330hb_language_matches (hb_language_t language,
331 hb_language_t specific);
332
333/**
334 * hb_script_t:
335 * @HB_SCRIPT_COMMON: `Zyyy`
336 * @HB_SCRIPT_INHERITED: `Zinh`
337 * @HB_SCRIPT_UNKNOWN: `Zzzz`
338 * @HB_SCRIPT_ARABIC: `Arab`
339 * @HB_SCRIPT_ARMENIAN: `Armn`
340 * @HB_SCRIPT_BENGALI: `Beng`
341 * @HB_SCRIPT_CYRILLIC: `Cyrl`
342 * @HB_SCRIPT_DEVANAGARI: `Deva`
343 * @HB_SCRIPT_GEORGIAN: `Geor`
344 * @HB_SCRIPT_GREEK: `Grek`
345 * @HB_SCRIPT_GUJARATI: `Gujr`
346 * @HB_SCRIPT_GURMUKHI: `Guru`
347 * @HB_SCRIPT_HANGUL: `Hang`
348 * @HB_SCRIPT_HAN: `Hani`
349 * @HB_SCRIPT_HEBREW: `Hebr`
350 * @HB_SCRIPT_HIRAGANA: `Hira`
351 * @HB_SCRIPT_KANNADA: `Knda`
352 * @HB_SCRIPT_KATAKANA: `Kana`
353 * @HB_SCRIPT_LAO: `Laoo`
354 * @HB_SCRIPT_LATIN: `Latn`
355 * @HB_SCRIPT_MALAYALAM: `Mlym`
356 * @HB_SCRIPT_ORIYA: `Orya`
357 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAMIL: `Taml`
358 * @HB_SCRIPT_TELUGU: `Telu`
359 * @HB_SCRIPT_THAI: `Thai`
360 * @HB_SCRIPT_TIBETAN: `Tibt`
361 * @HB_SCRIPT_BOPOMOFO: `Bopo`
362 * @HB_SCRIPT_BRAILLE: `Brai`
363 * @HB_SCRIPT_CANADIAN_SYLLABICS: `Cans`
364 * @HB_SCRIPT_CHEROKEE: `Cher`
365 * @HB_SCRIPT_ETHIOPIC: `Ethi`
366 * @HB_SCRIPT_KHMER: `Khmr`
367 * @HB_SCRIPT_MONGOLIAN: `Mong`
368 * @HB_SCRIPT_MYANMAR: `Mymr`
369 * @HB_SCRIPT_OGHAM: `Ogam`
370 * @HB_SCRIPT_RUNIC: `Runr`
371 * @HB_SCRIPT_SINHALA: `Sinh`
372 * @HB_SCRIPT_SYRIAC: `Syrc`
373 * @HB_SCRIPT_THAANA: `Thaa`
374 * @HB_SCRIPT_YI: `Yiii`
375 * @HB_SCRIPT_DESERET: `Dsrt`
376 * @HB_SCRIPT_GOTHIC: `Goth`
377 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_ITALIC: `Ital`
378 * @HB_SCRIPT_BUHID: `Buhd`
379 * @HB_SCRIPT_HANUNOO: `Hano`
380 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAGALOG: `Tglg`
381 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAGBANWA: `Tagb`
382 * @HB_SCRIPT_CYPRIOT: `Cprt`
383 * @HB_SCRIPT_LIMBU: `Limb`
384 * @HB_SCRIPT_LINEAR_B: `Linb`
385 * @HB_SCRIPT_OSMANYA: `Osma`
386 * @HB_SCRIPT_SHAVIAN: `Shaw`
387 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAI_LE: `Tale`
388 * @HB_SCRIPT_UGARITIC: `Ugar`
389 * @HB_SCRIPT_BUGINESE: `Bugi`
390 * @HB_SCRIPT_COPTIC: `Copt`
391 * @HB_SCRIPT_GLAGOLITIC: `Glag`
392 * @HB_SCRIPT_KHAROSHTHI: `Khar`
393 * @HB_SCRIPT_NEW_TAI_LUE: `Talu`
394 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_PERSIAN: `Xpeo`
395 * @HB_SCRIPT_SYLOTI_NAGRI: `Sylo`
396 * @HB_SCRIPT_TIFINAGH: `Tfng`
397 * @HB_SCRIPT_BALINESE: `Bali`
398 * @HB_SCRIPT_CUNEIFORM: `Xsux`
399 * @HB_SCRIPT_NKO: `Nkoo`
400 * @HB_SCRIPT_PHAGS_PA: `Phag`
401 * @HB_SCRIPT_PHOENICIAN: `Phnx`
402 * @HB_SCRIPT_CARIAN: `Cari`
403 * @HB_SCRIPT_CHAM: `Cham`
404 * @HB_SCRIPT_KAYAH_LI: `Kali`
405 * @HB_SCRIPT_LEPCHA: `Lepc`
406 * @HB_SCRIPT_LYCIAN: `Lyci`
407 * @HB_SCRIPT_LYDIAN: `Lydi`

423 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_SOUTH_ARABIAN: `Sarb`
424 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_TURKIC: `Orkh`
425 * @HB_SCRIPT_SAMARITAN: `Samr`
426 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAI_THAM: `Lana`
427 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAI_VIET: `Tavt`
428 * @HB_SCRIPT_BATAK: `Batk`
429 * @HB_SCRIPT_BRAHMI: `Brah`
430 * @HB_SCRIPT_MANDAIC: `Mand`
431 * @HB_SCRIPT_CHAKMA: `Cakm`
432 * @HB_SCRIPT_MEROITIC_CURSIVE: `Merc`
433 * @HB_SCRIPT_MEROITIC_HIEROGLYPHS: `Mero`
434 * @HB_SCRIPT_MIAO: `Plrd`
435 * @HB_SCRIPT_SHARADA: `Shrd`
436 * @HB_SCRIPT_SORA_SOMPENG: `Sora`
437 * @HB_SCRIPT_TAKRI: `Takr`
438 * @HB_SCRIPT_BASSA_VAH: `Bass`, Since: 0.9.30
439 * @HB_SCRIPT_CAUCASIAN_ALBANIAN: `Aghb`, Since: 0.9.30
440 * @HB_SCRIPT_DUPLOYAN: `Dupl`, Since: 0.9.30
441 * @HB_SCRIPT_ELBASAN: `Elba`, Since: 0.9.30
442 * @HB_SCRIPT_GRANTHA: `Gran`, Since: 0.9.30
443 * @HB_SCRIPT_KHOJKI: `Khoj`, Since: 0.9.30
444 * @HB_SCRIPT_KHUDAWADI: `Sind`, Since: 0.9.30
445 * @HB_SCRIPT_LINEAR_A: `Lina`, Since: 0.9.30
446 * @HB_SCRIPT_MAHAJANI: `Mahj`, Since: 0.9.30
447 * @HB_SCRIPT_MANICHAEAN: `Mani`, Since: 0.9.30
448 * @HB_SCRIPT_MENDE_KIKAKUI: `Mend`, Since: 0.9.30
449 * @HB_SCRIPT_MODI: `Modi`, Since: 0.9.30
450 * @HB_SCRIPT_MRO: `Mroo`, Since: 0.9.30
451 * @HB_SCRIPT_NABATAEAN: `Nbat`, Since: 0.9.30
452 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_NORTH_ARABIAN: `Narb`, Since: 0.9.30
453 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_PERMIC: `Perm`, Since: 0.9.30
454 * @HB_SCRIPT_PAHAWH_HMONG: `Hmng`, Since: 0.9.30
455 * @HB_SCRIPT_PALMYRENE: `Palm`, Since: 0.9.30
456 * @HB_SCRIPT_PAU_CIN_HAU: `Pauc`, Since: 0.9.30
457 * @HB_SCRIPT_PSALTER_PAHLAVI: `Phlp`, Since: 0.9.30
458 * @HB_SCRIPT_SIDDHAM: `Sidd`, Since: 0.9.30
459 * @HB_SCRIPT_TIRHUTA: `Tirh`, Since: 0.9.30
460 * @HB_SCRIPT_WARANG_CITI: `Wara`, Since: 0.9.30
461 * @HB_SCRIPT_AHOM: `Ahom`, Since: 0.9.30
462 * @HB_SCRIPT_ANATOLIAN_HIEROGLYPHS: `Hluw`, Since: 0.9.30
463 * @HB_SCRIPT_HATRAN: `Hatr`, Since: 0.9.30
464 * @HB_SCRIPT_MULTANI: `Mult`, Since: 0.9.30
465 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_HUNGARIAN: `Hung`, Since: 0.9.30
466 * @HB_SCRIPT_SIGNWRITING: `Sgnw`, Since: 0.9.30
467 * @HB_SCRIPT_ADLAM: `Adlm`, Since: 1.3.0
468 * @HB_SCRIPT_BHAIKSUKI: `Bhks`, Since: 1.3.0
469 * @HB_SCRIPT_MARCHEN: `Marc`, Since: 1.3.0
470 * @HB_SCRIPT_OSAGE: `Osge`, Since: 1.3.0
471 * @HB_SCRIPT_TANGUT: `Tang`, Since: 1.3.0
472 * @HB_SCRIPT_NEWA: `Newa`, Since: 1.3.0
473 * @HB_SCRIPT_MASARAM_GONDI: `Gonm`, Since: 1.6.0
474 * @HB_SCRIPT_NUSHU: `Nshu`, Since: 1.6.0
475 * @HB_SCRIPT_SOYOMBO: `Soyo`, Since: 1.6.0
476 * @HB_SCRIPT_ZANABAZAR_SQUARE: `Zanb`, Since: 1.6.0
477 * @HB_SCRIPT_DOGRA: `Dogr`, Since: 1.8.0
478 * @HB_SCRIPT_GUNJALA_GONDI: `Gong`, Since: 1.8.0
479 * @HB_SCRIPT_HANIFI_ROHINGYA: `Rohg`, Since: 1.8.0
480 * @HB_SCRIPT_MAKASAR: `Maka`, Since: 1.8.0
481 * @HB_SCRIPT_MEDEFAIDRIN: `Medf`, Since: 1.8.0
482 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_SOGDIAN: `Sogo`, Since: 1.8.0
483 * @HB_SCRIPT_SOGDIAN: `Sogd`, Since: 1.8.0
484 * @HB_SCRIPT_ELYMAIC: `Elym`, Since: 2.4.0
485 * @HB_SCRIPT_NANDINAGARI: `Nand`, Since: 2.4.0
486 * @HB_SCRIPT_NYIAKENG_PUACHUE_HMONG: `Hmnp`, Since: 2.4.0
487 * @HB_SCRIPT_WANCHO: `Wcho`, Since: 2.4.0
488 * @HB_SCRIPT_CHORASMIAN: `Chrs`, Since: 2.6.7
489 * @HB_SCRIPT_DIVES_AKURU: `Diak`, Since: 2.6.7
490 * @HB_SCRIPT_KHITAN_SMALL_SCRIPT: `Kits`, Since: 2.6.7
491 * @HB_SCRIPT_YEZIDI: `Yezi`, Since: 2.6.7
492 * @HB_SCRIPT_CYPRO_MINOAN: `Cpmn`, Since: 3.0.0
493 * @HB_SCRIPT_OLD_UYGHUR: `Ougr`, Since: 3.0.0
494 * @HB_SCRIPT_TANGSA: `Tnsa`, Since: 3.0.0
495 * @HB_SCRIPT_TOTO: `Toto`, Since: 3.0.0
496 * @HB_SCRIPT_VITHKUQI: `Vith`, Since: 3.0.0
497 * @HB_SCRIPT_MATH: `Zmth`, Since: 3.4.0
498 * @HB_SCRIPT_KAWI: `Kawi`, Since: 5.2.0
499 * @HB_SCRIPT_NAG_MUNDARI: `Nagm`, Since: 5.2.0
500 * @HB_SCRIPT_INVALID: No script set
501 *
502 * Data type for scripts. Each #hb_script_t's value is an #hb_tag_t corresponding
503 * to the four-letter values defined by [ISO 15924](https://unicode.org/iso15924/).
504 *
505 * See also the Script (sc) property of the Unicode Character Database.
506 *
507 **/
508
509/* https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y90M0Ie3MUJ6UVCRDOypOtijlMDLNNyyLk36T6iMu0o */
510typedef enum
511{
512 HB_SCRIPT_COMMON = HB_TAG ('Z','y','y','y'), /*1.1*/
513 HB_SCRIPT_INHERITED = HB_TAG ('Z','i','n','h'), /*1.1*/
514 HB_SCRIPT_UNKNOWN = HB_TAG ('Z','z','z','z'), /*5.0*/
515
516 HB_SCRIPT_ARABIC = HB_TAG ('A','r','a','b'), /*1.1*/
517 HB_SCRIPT_ARMENIAN = HB_TAG ('A','r','m','n'), /*1.1*/
518 HB_SCRIPT_BENGALI = HB_TAG ('B','e','n','g'), /*1.1*/
519 HB_SCRIPT_CYRILLIC = HB_TAG ('C','y','r','l'), /*1.1*/
520 HB_SCRIPT_DEVANAGARI = HB_TAG ('D','e','v','a'), /*1.1*/
521 HB_SCRIPT_GEORGIAN = HB_TAG ('G','e','o','r'), /*1.1*/
522 HB_SCRIPT_GREEK = HB_TAG ('G','r','e','k'), /*1.1*/
523 HB_SCRIPT_GUJARATI = HB_TAG ('G','u','j','r'), /*1.1*/
524 HB_SCRIPT_GURMUKHI = HB_TAG ('G','u','r','u'), /*1.1*/
525 HB_SCRIPT_HANGUL = HB_TAG ('H','a','n','g'), /*1.1*/
526 HB_SCRIPT_HAN = HB_TAG ('H','a','n','i'), /*1.1*/
527 HB_SCRIPT_HEBREW = HB_TAG ('H','e','b','r'), /*1.1*/

727 /* No script set. */

729
730 /*< private >*/
731
732 /* Dummy values to ensure any hb_tag_t value can be passed/stored as hb_script_t
733 * without risking undefined behavior. We have two, for historical reasons.
734 * HB_TAG_MAX used to be unsigned, but that was invalid Ansi C, so was changed
735 * to _HB_SCRIPT_MAX_VALUE to be equal to HB_TAG_MAX_SIGNED as well.
736 *
737 * See this thread for technicalities:
738 *
739 * https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/harfbuzz/2014-March/004150.html
740 */
741 _HB_SCRIPT_MAX_VALUE = HB_TAG_MAX_SIGNED, /*< skip >*/
742 _HB_SCRIPT_MAX_VALUE_SIGNED = HB_TAG_MAX_SIGNED /*< skip >*/
743
744} hb_script_t;

756hb_script_to_iso15924_tag (hb_script_t script);

759hb_script_get_horizontal_direction (hb_script_t script);

762/* User data */
763
764/**
765 * hb_user_data_key_t:
766 *
767 * Data structure for holding user-data keys.
768 *
769 **/
770typedef struct hb_user_data_key_t {
771 /*< private >*/
772 char unused;
773} hb_user_data_key_t;
774
775/**
776 * hb_destroy_func_t:
777 * @user_data: the data to be destroyed
778 *
779 * A virtual method for destroy user-data callbacks.
780 *
781 */
782typedef void (*hb_destroy_func_t) (void *user_data);
783
784
785/* Font features and variations. */
786
787/**
788 * HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START:
789 *
790 * Special setting for #hb_feature_t.start to apply the feature from the start
791 * of the buffer.
792 *
793 * Since: 2.0.0
794 */
795#define HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START 0
796
797/**
798 * HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END:
799 *
800 * Special setting for #hb_feature_t.end to apply the feature from to the end
801 * of the buffer.
802 *
803 * Since: 2.0.0
804 */
805#define HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END ((unsigned int) -1)
806
807/**
808 * hb_feature_t:
809 * @tag: The #hb_tag_t tag of the feature
810 * @value: The value of the feature. 0 disables the feature, non-zero (usually
811 * 1) enables the feature. For features implemented as lookup type 3 (like
812 * 'salt') the @value is a one based index into the alternates.
813 * @start: the cluster to start applying this feature setting (inclusive).
814 * @end: the cluster to end applying this feature setting (exclusive).
815 *
816 * The #hb_feature_t is the structure that holds information about requested
817 * feature application. The feature will be applied with the given value to all
818 * glyphs which are in clusters between @start (inclusive) and @end (exclusive).
819 * Setting start to #HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START and end to #HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END
820 * specifies that the feature always applies to the entire buffer.
821 */
822typedef struct hb_feature_t {
823 hb_tag_t tag;
824 uint32_t value;
825 unsigned int start;
826 unsigned int end;
827} hb_feature_t;
828
829HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
830hb_feature_from_string (const char *str, int len,
831 hb_feature_t *feature);
832
833HB_EXTERN void
834hb_feature_to_string (hb_feature_t *feature,
835 char *buf, unsigned int size);
836
837/**
838 * hb_variation_t:
839 * @tag: The #hb_tag_t tag of the variation-axis name
840 * @value: The value of the variation axis
841 *
842 * Data type for holding variation data. Registered OpenType
843 * variation-axis tags are listed in
844 * [OpenType Axis Tag Registry](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/dvaraxisreg).
845 *
846 * Since: 1.4.2
847 */
848typedef struct hb_variation_t {
849 hb_tag_t tag;
850 float value;
851} hb_variation_t;
852
853HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
854hb_variation_from_string (const char *str, int len,
855 hb_variation_t *variation);
856
857HB_EXTERN void
858hb_variation_to_string (hb_variation_t *variation,
859 char *buf, unsigned int size);
860
861/**
862 * hb_color_t:
863 *
864 * Data type for holding color values. Colors are eight bits per
865 * channel RGB plus alpha transparency.
866 *
867 * Since: 2.1.0
868 */
869typedef uint32_t hb_color_t;
870
871/**
872 * HB_COLOR:
873 * @b: blue channel value
874 * @g: green channel value
875 * @r: red channel value
876 * @a: alpha channel value
877 *
878 * Constructs an #hb_color_t from four integers.
879 *
880 * Since: 2.1.0
881 */
882#define HB_COLOR(b,g,r,a) ((hb_color_t) HB_TAG ((b),(g),(r),(a)))
883
884HB_EXTERN uint8_t
885hb_color_get_alpha (hb_color_t color);
886#define hb_color_get_alpha(color) ((color) & 0xFF)
887
888HB_EXTERN uint8_t
889hb_color_get_red (hb_color_t color);
890#define hb_color_get_red(color) (((color) >> 8) & 0xFF)
891
892HB_EXTERN uint8_t
893hb_color_get_green (hb_color_t color);
894#define hb_color_get_green(color) (((color) >> 16) & 0xFF)
895
896HB_EXTERN uint8_t
897hb_color_get_blue (hb_color_t color);
898#define hb_color_get_blue(color) (((color) >> 24) & 0xFF)
899
900/**
901 * hb_glyph_extents_t:
902 * @x_bearing: Distance from the x-origin to the left extremum of the glyph.
903 * @y_bearing: Distance from the top extremum of the glyph to the y-origin.
904 * @width: Distance from the left extremum of the glyph to the right extremum.
905 * @height: Distance from the top extremum of the glyph to the bottom extremum.
906 *
907 * Glyph extent values, measured in font units.
908 *
909 * Note that @height is negative, in coordinate systems that grow up.
910 **/
911typedef struct hb_glyph_extents_t {
912 hb_position_t x_bearing;
913 hb_position_t y_bearing;
914 hb_position_t width;
915 hb_position_t height;
916} hb_glyph_extents_t;
917
918/**
919 * hb_font_t:
920 *
921 * Data type for holding fonts.
922 *
923 */
924typedef struct hb_font_t hb_font_t;
925
926HB_END_DECLS

928#endif /* HB_COMMON_H */
